attributes.action: No Trump in the UK if he deports Muslim citizens from US with no terror links
attributes.background: We believe that the UK is a multicultural country and if Donald Trump begins to deport Muslim citizens from US with no terror links this is clearly for racial reasons. If the UK government allows him to enter this suggests that they agree with and support his policies.

attributes.action: Ban hospitals from charging for parking in England
attributes.background:
Scotland and Wales do not charge for parking at their NHS hospitals.  Why do England charge us to park for essential visits to hospital?
People are being charged extortionate amounts to access healthcare when they have already paid taxes and National Insurance.
attributes.additional_details:
As an ex NHS nurse, I remember when hospital car parks were free.  I can also remember, that when charges came into force, I had to claim the money back from the NHS when I was visiting a patient!
My local hospital Trust has collected over £4m in car parking charges over the last year.  I am sure this money goes over and above the required amount to operate the car parks.  Scotland and Wales provide free car parking. There is a definate disparity in fairness and policy.
WHY?

attributes.action: End all government subsides and other financial aid to the fossil fuel industry.
attributes.background: The UK government provides the domestic fossil fuel industry with funds to the tune of £6 billion annually. This industry, endangering all of us by intensifying climate change, is getting money from our government at the expense of the taxpayer. This has to stop before it is too late.
attributes.additional_details:
Direct subsides are hard to calculate –  Reasonable mid-range figure is £6 billion annually, given by widely trusted sources such as the Independent and the Overseas Development Institute(ODI) however the UK claims not to have any using an irrational definition. The International Monetary Fund puts the figure much higher at £26b.
This petition's specific demand is that fossil fuel subsides, as defined by the ODI are to be abolished by 2020 and the extra revenue should be invested in clean energy.

attributes.action: Commercial images of photoshopped bodies should be marked 'retouched photo'.
attributes.background: Conditions such as anorexia and muscle dysmorphic disorder are more common than ever. We are bombarded by photoshopped bodies in advertising campaigns and magazines, creating unrealistic expectations of what a healthy body looks like. I wish for government legislation to be passed to combat this.
attributes.additional_details: This year, France bring into law legislation, stating that any image that has been digitally altered to change a model's body shape must be marked 'retouched photograph': Any companies found to be breaching these rules will be fined  37,500 Euros. I propose that the British government follow suit and pass legislation in order to make it unlawful for fashion magazines and advertising campaigns to fail to disclose that models' images have been digitally altered.

attributes.action: Make "sex and relationship" education compulsory in all schools.
attributes.background: All teenagers need to learn about appropriate, consensual relationships and sex. Some young people are lucky enough to have appropriate and necessary talks with parents/carers but this is not always the case so needs to be the responsibility of schools.
attributes.additional_details: This is especially crucial for young LGBT+ people because it is unlikely that many parents/carers will cover LGBT+ issues with their children. Look at the "legacy" that Section 28 has left, including a high proportion mental health issues among LGBT+. Faith schools are not exempt from this because they do not agree with homosexuality, if anything it is even more crucial that LGBT students here are set up for a healthy adult life.

attributes.action: Amnesty for illegal immigrants who have avoided detection for 10 years
attributes.background: Amnesty to those who have avoided detection for 10 years would be economically beneficial. These people are unable to contribute to this economy, unable to pay taxes, even though they have been work (cash in hand i.e) and unable to take proper part in society.

attributes.action: To withhold the funding to abstentionist MPs and their parties.
attributes.background: We the British taxpayer demand that the government stop all parliamentary funding to those abstentionist MPs and their parties, who refuse to take their seats in the House of Commons, and the saved moneys be redirected to the NHS budget for better use.

attributes.action: Carers allowance,Caring for loved ones,by right even if claiming a State Pension
attributes.background: Mandy Bayliffe wanted " The Carers Charter " to protect all Carers from cuts and provide a framework of support via community care free at the point of need. Respite , home support and even sitting Services exempt from any charges or assessment. Many Carers die of exhaustion ,so we have to act now.
attributes.additional_details: There are almost 1.5 million Carers at home who cannot claim the allowance because they are in receipt of a State Pension, which most paid through employment. Go to www.carersassociation.info which shows all the stats in care. The allowance must be paid free of tax or any benefit assessments as with PIPS , when claiming Pension credits or Housing benefits . Child Carers must receive Education credits for when they may wish to move on to College on University . This will help reduce their fees .

attributes.action: Create awareness of Peritoneal Mesothelioma and support clinical trials for cure
attributes.background: The government must raise awareness of peritoneal mesothelioma so health professionals and the public are aware of the signs and symptoms of this rare, but increasing, disease, leading to earlier diagnosis and better prognosis for patients.they must also support clinical trials to help find a cure.
attributes.additional_details: My mum was diagnosed with peritoneal mesothelioma 2 yrs ago after 6 yrs of symptoms and numerous misdiagnoses. she was given 2 Weeks to live a yr ago but still fights on.Mums diagnosis came too late for her to have life lengthening surgery,and at every turn we are told there is nothing that can be done. Many Drs haven't even heard of the illness.No trials are ongoing for a cure because "drugs companies won't make enough money due to the relatively small number of people with the disease"

attributes.action: Enable voting rights for British expats for the General Election on 8 June 2017
attributes.background:
British expats living outside the U.K. for more than 15 years aren't allowed to vote in elections & weren't allowed to vote in the EU Referendum which directly affects their lives.

Theresa May promised expats voting rights for the 2020 election. We need them now for the 2017 election!
attributes.additional_details:
Being a British expat does not mean that we cease to have an interest in how our country is run - especially having friends & family still living there. As British citizens living abroad, we are still governed by British laws & impacted by decisions made by government, and should therefore be able to vote.

Please sign & share with as many people as possible so that this is addressed in time for the election.

http://www.moneyinternational.com/news/may-promises-lift-expat-vote-ban-next-election/

attributes.action: Reverse Philip Hammond's decision to abolish Class 2 NICs
attributes.background: Philip Hammond proposes to abolish Class 2 National Insurance Credits, a move which targets the lowest self-employed earners - many of whom make only a few thousand pounds a year - and will force them to increase NIC payments by 400-500% in order to preserve their State Pension. This is unfair.
attributes.additional_details: These measures unfairly target self employed people under the small earnings threshold who make less than £6,000 a year. People who are forced to work part-time due to caring responsibilities, children, old age or disability, or in low paying sectors such as the arts, will need to find an extra £600 a year, or else lose entitlement to their state pension. These workers have no access to employer subsidised work pensions and any provision for retirement they make already costs twice as much.

attributes.action: Sociology should be an EBacc subject.
attributes.background:
Sociology enhances a student's understanding of CONTEMPORARY society, just as History provides an appreciation of significant events of the past. Why is one considered more worthy knowledge than the other?
Perhaps the government does not want today's students to understand modern Britain?

attributes.action: Have advertisements on tv, the dangers of anyone taking risks around HGVs
attributes.background: A worry in this country is people's unawareness of how there actions can lead to fatilities around Hgvs we need to build awareness and I think having advertisements on TVs could really make a big difference and hopefully save life's for cyclists and many more

attributes.action: Decommission Trident missiles.
attributes.background: When the NHS is under immense strain, it is appalling to know that the single nuclear Trident warhead that missed its target zone cost the UK £17,000,000. Trident is also far more an aggressor than a defense, so I urge everyone who sees this- In the name of Peace and Prosperity, help disarm Trident!
attributes.additional_details: The single missile that failed cost £17,000,000- the same cost as the cost of employing 700 nurses for the NHS a year- it is already strained, with pregnant women having to wait up to 4 hours to be seen. This was lied about in Parliament and so it is fair to have it debated again.

attributes.action: Encourage 16 nations who ban Israeli passport holders to lift their ban.
attributes.background: In the recent events over President Donald Trump putting a temporary ban on nationals from 7 nations entering the USA it came to light that 16 nations had a permanent ban on Israeli passport holders from entering their countries. These nations need to be encouraged to lift that ban.

attributes.action: Prevent Donald Trump from UK Entry
attributes.background: The signatories believe Donald J Trump should be banned from UK entry. This is a resubmission of the previous petition prior to his election.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK has banned entry to many individuals for hate speech. The same principles should apply to everyone who wishes to enter the UK. 

If the United Kingdom is to continue applying the 'unacceptable behaviour' criteria to those who wish to enter its borders, it must be fairly applied to the rich as well as poor, and the weak as well as powerful.

attributes.action: Make it UK law to label all consumer products as vegan/vegetarian/non-vegetarian
attributes.background: There has been numerous times when I have discovered (by contacting companies) a product is vegetarian, yet it is not disclosed on the packaging. Stating items as vegan/vegetarian or not should become a legal requirement as it would make it easier to purchase according to each individual lifestyle.
attributes.additional_details: This law should apply to ALL consumer products sold in the UK from food and drink to cosmetics and everyday essentials, such as toothpaste and hand wash.

attributes.action: Demand easy re-registration of British-registered vehicles in other EU countries
attributes.background: British citizens re-registering their vehicles abroad (in the EU) are experienced serious and costly administrative obstruction, or being refused. Vehicles presented in EU states with accompanying V5C that states the vehicle's EC Type Approval Number should be allowed easy and low-cost registration.
attributes.additional_details:
A core principle of the EU is freedom of movement of citizens and labour. Migrating citizens' vehicles should be easy to re-register in EU states if the registrant presents an EC Type Approval Number as printed on the UK V5C. This number proves EU-wide road conformity for the vehicle.

This is supported by  EC directive 2007/C68/04 which states that a vehicle already registered in a member state should not be tested again on the same criteria at re-registration or have to undergo further tests.

attributes.action: End unlawful detention without trial for political opponents in Bangladesh
attributes.background: Since 2009 the Bangladesh government have been purging members of opposition parties, in particular the Bangladesh National Party (BNP).  In August 2016 Hummam Chowdhury and Mir Ahmad Bin Quasem with links to the BNP, were picked arrested and continue to be unlawfully detained without trial.
attributes.additional_details: We call on the UK government to put diplomatic pressure on the Bangladesh government and Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina to immediately end the detention of political opponents of the Awami League Party and release Mr Chowdhury and Mr Bin Quasem.  The UK government should do everything it can to prevent further human rights abuses in Bangladesh and should consider pressing for sanctions with the international community if this practice persists.

attributes.action: Start education programmes in schools to highlight the recurrence of sexism
attributes.background: Sexism is an everyday problem that should be a concern to all of us. Even if we think that it is gradually improving as time moves on, it isn't. Catcalling and gender stereotyping and targeting is a huge issue, and much of the younger generation seems to find it acceptable because of many influences
attributes.additional_details: By introducing an education programme in secondary schools, we can teach everyone, no matter what gender, about everyday sexism, how it affects people and how it can be prevented. This will lead us one step closer to getting rid of sexism once and for all.

attributes.action: Set a legal minimum body size for mannequins displaying clothes in shops
attributes.background: Clothing mannequins are often too thin. Many portray unrealistic body sizes/shapes that are unhealthy if not impossible to achieve. It promotes serious self-esteem issues and eating disorders. We should feel beautiful without sacrificing our health. A minimum mannequin size is a step towards this.
attributes.additional_details: 1)Barbies with more realistic figures have been developed. Why can't we do the same with the bodies that display the very clothes we wear? 2)It effects men and women but young girls are particularly vulnerable. Eating disorders are one type of a serious condition fuelled by this ridiculous image. 3)Physical AND mental health is at risk and this could easily be avoided 4)one news article: https://au.be.yahoo.com/lifestyle/a/34933378/topshop-mannequins-spark-outrage-for-being-too-thin-yahoo7-be/

attributes.action: Stop prescribing medicines such as Paracetamol on the NHS!
attributes.background: The NHS spent £87.6 million pounds last year on paracetamol tablets which can be bought 20 times cheaper in a supermarket. Doctors wrote 22.9 million prescriptions at an average cost of £3.83. These painkillers can be bought in supermarkets for as little as 19p!!!!
attributes.additional_details: Let us all do out bit and let us help the NHS put its funding to better use. Lets stop prescribing medicines for common colds which can be bought so cheaply and freely in any supermarket or corner shop!

attributes.action: Make humira free to patients with the eye condition uvietus
attributes.background: Uvietus can make people lose their eyesight , humira is known to settle the uvietus down and stop it flaring up giving the patient a chance of getting their eyes operated on , ie cataract operation. This drug is free in Scotland and Wales but not from NHS England . Why

attributes.action: Reduce the age of breast screening from 50 to 30yrs old or even 20.
attributes.background:
I have heard the there is a big increase in breat cancer in younger women. Some cases of which its too late. 
By reducing the breast screening age it will in the long run save NHS costs but most importantly save lifes. I have had friends as young as 26 been disgnosed.
attributes.additional_details:
www.ons.gov.uk/peoplepopulationandcommunity/healthandsocialcare/conditionsanddiseases/bulletins/cancerregistrationstatisticsengland/2014

This is from 2014. But breast cancer is one of the ones that is on the increase. Can it be help? Can it be picked up sooner? 
The answer is yes if the the age for breast screening is reduced from 50 to 30 or even to 20.

attributes.action: Mandatory First Aid training and certificate to all students 15-18 years old
attributes.background: Mandatory First Aid training is excellent as no one ever knows if or when a medical situation will arise, therefore these skills will be necessary in order to save lives.
attributes.additional_details:
Approximately 140,000 people every year die in situations where their lives could have been saved if somebody had known first aid according to a article from the Guardian. 
Around 2 million people are in secondary education, therefore providing mandatory first aid to would decrease the numbers of people dying due to preventative deaths significantly.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of vehicle/ van lock picks in the UK
attributes.background: In a new scandal, hundreds of vans are having their security systems bypassed by lock picks used by thieves. All doors are unlocked and the alarm turned off, so that thieves can relieve tradesmen of their hard earned tools, taking away their livelihood and taking food off tables.

attributes.action: Government introduce & underwrite affordability mortgages for first time buyers
attributes.background: It's unfair that young people have to pay such extortionate rents & may never own their own homes.  They are paying incredibly high rents with no security and this has to be re-balanced.  If they have been proven to pay rent &  have good credit history they should be able to own their own home

attributes.action: Establish legal presumption of shared, 50:50, care after parents' break up
attributes.background:
The adversarial character of family legal system is not fit for purpose.
The bias of legal professionals ( lawers, social workers, caffcass officers, family centres staff, judges) is causing more harm then good . Simple initial presumption of 50 :50 child care split will give power back to parents
attributes.additional_details:
In Sweden approximately40% of separated parents share care 50:50 and it is higher amongst younger children.
In the majority of cases the minimum of shared parenting is 30%
Just 2% of disputes are resolved in court

attributes.action: Raise the wages for those working in HM Prison Services
attributes.background: The average wage for a Prison officer in the UK is not only low, but is also 10 thousand (in pounds) less than the average paid to prison officers in the USA.
attributes.additional_details: Our Prison officers have a very tough and demanding job. Our Prison officers experience every day things most of us would never have to think about or Imagine. Not to mention the hours they serve, and the unsociable times they serve them through. There have been cuts after cuts with the prison service, and its gone on too far. The ratio of HMP staff to number of prisoners is dangerous. Pay our men and woman in the prison service a fair wage for the hard work that they do! Match the USA average.

attributes.action: Require packaging to state that a product has been tested on animals
attributes.background: We are petitioning for products to advertise their use or lack of cruelty-free testing as a requirement. This allows buyers to make an informed decision on products and their ethics.
attributes.additional_details: Over 3 million animals are tested on each year and many of these tests are unnecessary. The bulk of testing can be carried out digitally and therefore this cruelty to animals is unneeded.

attributes.action: Ban the giving of goldfish as prizes at fairgrounds in the UK.
attributes.background: All over the UK fairgrounds and similar events are still giving away goldfish as prizes, this is an outdated practice that needs to be banned as these fish are kept in poor condition and it goes against all the work that goes into educating the public on how to properly look after their fish.
attributes.additional_details: Goldfish have a long life span, require a large volume of water to swim around in and also consume a large amount of oxygen. These fish grow to a large size when fully grown (around 36cm) and also produce a lot of waste compared to many other species available in the aquarium trade. It is universally accepted that one common goldfish needs at least 70 litres on its own with a bigger tank always being better and goldfish as prizes only adds to the problem of people thinking they are expendable.

attributes.action: Regulate mobile phone bundled contracts to stop hidden charges & data misselling
attributes.background: Consumer request to regulate over-charging in 24 month bundled contracts, ensuring clearer, transparent pricing for both the phone and the tariff in the contract, ensuring customers can get access to their data consumption and aren’t overcharged for data they don’t need, or overpay for the phone.
attributes.additional_details:
consumers know they aren't getting the best deal http://www.thisismoney.co.uk/money/bills/article-3517540/The-mobile-phone-rip-Confusing-tariffs-unclear-pricing-shoddy-sales-staff-mean-overpaying-130-phone-contracts.html 
over £5bn per year being wasted by being on the wrong contracts https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2011/apr/11/mobile-phone-users-wasting-5bn customers need have greater access and more control over their service contracts with the networks http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3973532/Millions-mobile-phone-users-able-ditch-supplier-mid-contract-t-signal-plan-MPs-beat-coverage-blackspots.html

attributes.action: Introduce Politics and Citizenship to the core UK school curriculum
attributes.background: In light of the recent Brexit and US presidential election, we strongly believe that all students should understand the nature of politics and their role and responsibilities as citizens and voters.

attributes.action: Force the legal separation of ticketing companies from ticket resale companies.
attributes.background:
Allowing ticketing companies to own related companies which can resell tickets at a higher price has an inherent conflict.
The ticketing companies have no interest in selling all tickets at original face value as they will inflate their profits by selling them through their related businesses.

attributes.action: change the criteria for disabled persons bus passes and include autism
attributes.background: I'm campaigning for a change in policy for disabled bus passes as I do strongly agree people with autism should be able to apply for one yet the department for transport classes autism as a learning disability which people with autism can some times have a learning disability but not all
attributes.additional_details: The Department for transport should change there criteria to include autism as not everyone with autism has a learning disability

attributes.action: Grant local authorities more power to remove illegal Traveller encampments
attributes.background: Grant local authorities more power to allow for the immediate removal of illegal encampments, protecting the rights and homes of the static community. Travellers to be forced to clear their own waste, instead of leaving it to us tax payers.
attributes.additional_details:
Recreation grounds, Community Centres and other public land has been targeted heavily in the West Midlands region during the last 12 months, with certain recreation grounds being affected 7 times in a 6 month period.
Birmingham City Council spent £299,472.16 removing illegal travellers and their waste during 2015 and 2016. This is on the increase, with the Parks Department, in conjunction with Environmental Officers, spending £52,836.31 in 2015 and £87,001.53 in 2016; an increase of £34.165.22.

attributes.action: Get compulsory lessons about ONLINE BULLYING taught in every school
attributes.background: People have come to us concerned about the rising problem of bullying on social media. JOIN our "Sticks and Stones" campaign, calling for the Government to enforce mandatory lessons in all schools giving advice on how to behave online, and how to safeguard yourself against online bullying.
attributes.additional_details:
We've spoken to countless victims of online bullying up and down the country. Some of which saw no way out, and considered suicide.
Some even succeeded.
The abuse is often relentless as more and more young people are constantly connected to the internet. 
We need to better educate our children about the effect their words can have.
The House of Lords recently recommended mandatory lessons about online responsibilities, risks and acceptable behaviour.

attributes.action: Make female hygiene dispensers compulsory in all secondary schools.
attributes.background: It is not realistic to expect all individuals to be prepared for an instance where they may need sanitary products, especially in adolescence. Products should be on offer in the case of an individual finding themselves unprepared, to avoid any stress or embarrassment.

attributes.action: Implement a statutory body to deal with animal welfare prosecutions
attributes.background: The animal welfare crisis is spiralling out of control the government are in denial,enforcement and prosecution is lacking on a large scale.Animals need a robust and enforced system.It must move on from private prosecution and the state should prosecute as it does in every other area of the law.

attributes.action: Fireworks - ONLY SOLD to the public with licence from Local Council @ £50.
attributes.background:
Sale of FIREWORKS - The way forward
a)  To purchase FIREWORKS public need to obtain a licence from their Local Council.  Licence should be at least £50, dates avail on a website.
b)  People need to use Facebook/media as a Communication tool to let others know about forthcoming firework displays.

attributes.action: Allow Retail Promotions of First Formula Milk once the UK leaves the EU.
attributes.background: EU law prohibits retailers from discounting new baby formula milk and from offering coupons or points with loyalty schemes. Whilst we know 'Breast is Best', what if a woman can't breastfeed or chooses not to? We should be able to choose how to feed our babies without justification or judgement.

attributes.action: Guarantee a minimum standard of contraceptive availability across the UK
attributes.background: The Independent and BBC report that funding cuts have caused some GPs to stop providing the contraceptive coil, IUD and contraceptive implant. It makes no sense to reduce access to cost-effective, proven modern contraceptive innovations; local authorities must receive adequate funds to provide this.
attributes.additional_details: Access to a full range of contraception prevents pregnancy (abortions and raising unplanned children are both more costly) and is vital for managing many health problems (thyroid malfunction, severe migraine/period pain, endometriosis). Government must a) require ring-fenced, guaranteed contraceptive funding (and reinstate provisions where cut) b) enforce minimum provisions: amount of options discussed with patients and available within a certain distance, and availability of long-acting methods

attributes.action: Make by Law all deceased to be Forensically photographed (UV etc digital).
attributes.background: With an increasing number of crimes against the elderly, vulnerable & children which are unknown to police. A proposal is that all deceased to be forensically UV photographed which would show bruises etc & flag serious issues. All images could be taken at the funeral parlor & uploaded to a computer.
attributes.additional_details:
It was the funeral parlor staff who found out about Dr Shipman, if they had been listened to sooner more lives would have been saved. 
This petition is supported by them and many others.
This can now be improved by the suggestion by making this detection process automatic. A computer program could scan photos for crimes then ask police for further actions.
This data could be stored and the cost is small compared to the other economics of criminal detection. Crimes would be more difficult to do.
attributes.creator_name: Dr Mark Jones Fellow of the Royal Society of Medicine

attributes.action: Pressure Myanmar's government to stop the genocide against the Rohingya people
attributes.background: Decades of discrimination and dehumanisation of the Rohingya, an ethnic minority in Myanmar, has ultimately led to genocidal violence from political and religious leaders since 2012, which "may amount to crimes against humanity". The country's leader, a Nobel Peace Prize Laureate, sits idly by.
attributes.additional_details:
Described by the UN as "the world's most persecuted minority", the Rohingya are an ethnic minority who have lived in Myanmar's Arakan state for generations. They were stripped of citizenship in 1982 and are victims of gross human rights violations.

We urge the UK government to pressure the Myanmar government to:
•Allow humanitarian and medical aid into the affected areas
•Allow the UN unrestricted access to conduct their investigations
•Recognise Rohingya as an official ethnic minority

attributes.action: Ask EU to clarify stance on independent Scotland as part of Brexit negotiations
attributes.background: We the Scottish people demand that as part of the Brexit negotiations that the Westminster Tory government ask the EU commission to make it perfectly clear what their position is on an independent Scotland seamlessly taking the place of the UK in EU after Scotland voted to remain in the EU

attributes.action: Increase the number of incontinence pads disabled children/adults are allowed.
attributes.background: Being a parent to a young disabled child I have the same problems as other parents or carers of disabled children and Adults the 3 day limit on incontinence pads is ridiculous my son cannot manage to stick to 3 changes a day as he develops sores and it's unhygienic the limit needs to be increased.
attributes.additional_details: Incontinence pads are there for children and adults who for whatever reason are unable to use the bathroom I feel it unfair and unhygienic that the allowance for this is 3 a day my son gets changed a minimum of 6 times a day he has Cerebral palsy spastic quadriplegia so he isn't aware of when he needs the toilet incontinence pads are an everyday need for him and for many others. Please please help me get this petition recognised and help others in a similar situation.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to breach a contact order issued by the family court.
attributes.background: Far too often non-resident parents spend £1000's in the family court system, to achieve a contact arrangement with their children, only to find the resident parent ignores it and the police are unwilling to take any action.There is rarely any penalty for breaches, and non-contact can go on for years
attributes.additional_details: By making breaching an order a criminal offence with a power of arrest, the police will be able to take action. I believe 99% of the time all that would be needed is for an officer to supervise a handover to the parent with court ordered contact. The power of arrest would enable action when the person with the child refuses to co-operate, also someone could be de-arrested once the child is with the correct parent. A court order is made in the best interests of the child, and should be respected.

attributes.action: When the UK leaves the EU British passports should have pink covers.
attributes.background: Leaving the EU is all about taking back control and making Britain great again. Let's set our sights high and, remembering the pink all across the globe just 100 years ago, let's have our British passports proudly clad in pink!

attributes.action: Vote of no confidence in the PM for failure to condemn US stance on refugees.
attributes.background: Theresa May has allied herself to President Trump bringing the UK into disrepute. We want a chance to show our displeasure by asking parliament for a vote of no confidence, triggering a general election

attributes.action: Enforce a minimum of 6 weeks Statutory Paternity Leave to all fathers at 90% pay
attributes.background: Fathers currently take 2 weeks paternity leave when their child is born. Mothers are entitled to 52 weeks (39 weeks paid Statutory). Fathers should spend the first 6 weeks with their babies & partners for support & bonding. Paternity leave should change to minimum 6 weeks at 90% of their salary.
